questions.question: What phenomenon is characterized by unusually warm ocean temperatures in the Equatorial Pacific?
Which branch of climatology is concerned with observing and understanding all aspects of the world's climate with respect to its variability and averages over various time scales?
What is the term for the average course or condition of the weather at a place usually over a period of years?
What atmospheric layer contains the ozone layer?
What is the term for the amount of solar radiation reflected off a surface, often expressed as a percentage?
What term is used to describe the study of climate change and its causes, processes, and effects on the planet?
What climate zone is characterized by little rainfall and large daily temperatures, and covers large parts of Western North America, Northern Africa, and central Australia?
Which wind system features dry, warm, descending air moving out towards the poles and is found at approximately 30 degrees latitude?
What is the process by which green plants and some other organisms use sunlight to synthesize foods with the help of carbon dioxide and water, and is a crucial part of the carbon cycle?
What climate phenomenon occurs approximately every two to seven years and can last up to two years, impacting global climate and weather patterns?
